TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit AL extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides access to the OpenAL 1.1 flat API.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void DeleteBuffer (int buffer);
.method public static hidebysig void DeleteBuffer(int32 buffer) cil managed
static member DeleteBuffer : int -> unit

Docs.param: Pointer to a buffer name identifying the buffer to be deleted.
Docs.summary: This function deletes one buffer only, freeing the resources used by the buffer. Buffers which are attached to a source can not be deleted. See AL.Source (ALSourcei) and AL.SourceUnqueueBuffers for information on how to detach a buffer from a source.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void DopplerFactor (float value);
.method public static hidebysig pinvokeimpl ("openal32.dll" as "alDopplerFactor" cdecl)void DopplerFactor(float32 value) cil managed
static member DopplerFactor : single -> unit

Docs.param: A negative value will result in an error, the command is then ignored. The default value is 1f. The current setting can be queried using AL.Get with parameter ALGetFloat.SpeedOfSound.
Docs.summary: AL.DopplerFactor is a simple scaling of source and listener velocities to exaggerate or deemphasize the Doppler (pitch) shift resulting from the calculation.

MemberSignature.Value: public static int GenBuffer ();
.method public static hidebysig int32 GenBuffer() cil managed
static member GenBuffer : unit -> int

Docs.summary: This function generates one buffer only, which contain audio data (see AL.BufferData). References to buffers are uint values, which are used wherever a buffer reference is needed (in calls such as AL.DeleteBuffers, AL.Source with parameter ALSourcei, AL.SourceQueueBuffers, and AL.SourceUnqueueBuffers).
Docs.returns: Pointer to an uint value which will store the name of the new buffer.

.method public static hidebysig void GenBuffer([out] unsigned int32& buffer) cil managed

MemberSignature.Value: public static int GetEnumValue (string ename);
.method public static hidebysig pinvokeimpl ("openal32.dll" as "alGetEnumValue" ansi cdecl)int32 GetEnumValue([in]string ename) cil managed
static member GetEnumValue : string -> int

Docs.param: A string describing an OpenAL token. Example "AL_DISTANCE_MODEL"
Docs.summary: This function returns the enumeration value of an OpenAL token, described by a string.
Docs.returns: Returns the actual ALenum described by a string. Returns 0 if the string doesn’t describe a valid OpenAL token.

Docs.param: A string containing the function name.
Docs.summary: This function returns the address of an OpenAL extension function. Handle with care.
Docs.returns: The return value is a pointer to the specified function. The return value will be IntPtr.Zero if the function is not found.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void SourcePlay (int sid);
.method public static hidebysig void SourcePlay(int32 sid) cil managed
static member SourcePlay : int -> unit

Docs.param: The name of the source to be played.
Docs.summary: This function plays, replays or resumes a source. The playing source will have it's state changed to ALSourceState.Playing. When called on a source which is already playing, the source will restart at the beginning. When the attached buffer(s) are done playing, the source will progress to the ALSourceState.Stopped state.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void SourceQueueBuffer (int source, int buffer);
.method public static hidebysig void SourceQueueBuffer(int32 source, int32 buffer) cil managed
static member SourceQueueBuffer : int * int -> unit

Docs.param: The name of the source to queue buffers onto.
The name of the buffer to be queued.
Docs.summary: This function queues a set of buffers on a source. All buffers attached to a source will be played in sequence, and the number of processed buffers can be detected using AL.GetSource with parameter ALGetSourcei.BuffersProcessed. When first created, a source will be of type ALSourceType.Undetermined. A successful AL.SourceQueueBuffers call will change the source type to ALSourceType.Streaming.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void SourceQueueBuffers (int sid, int numEntries, int[] bids);

All buffers attached to a source will be played in sequence, and the number of processed buffers can be detected using AL.GetSource with parameter ALGetSourcei.BuffersProcessed. When first created, a source will be of type ALSourceType.Undetermined. A successful AL.SourceQueueBuffers call will change the source type to ALSourceType.Streaming.

MemberSignature.Value: public static int SourceUnqueueBuffer (int sid);
.method public static hidebysig int32 SourceUnqueueBuffer(int32 sid) cil managed
static member SourceUnqueueBuffer : int -> int

Docs.param: The name of the source to unqueue buffers from.
Docs.summary: This function unqueues a set of buffers attached to a source. The number of processed buffers can be detected using AL.GetSource with parameter ALGetSourcei.BuffersProcessed, which is the maximum number of buffers that can be unqueued using this call. The unqueue operation will only take place if all n buffers can be removed from the queue.

static member SourceUnqueueBuffers : uint32 * int * -> unit

Docs.param: The name of the source to unqueue buffers from.
The number of buffers to be unqueued.
A pointer to an array of buffer names that were removed.
Docs.summary: This function unqueues a set of buffers attached to a source. The number of processed buffers can be detected using AL.GetSource with parameter ALGetSourcei.BuffersProcessed, which is the maximum number of buffers that can be unqueued using this call. The unqueue operation will only take place if all n buffers can be removed from the queue.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void SpeedOfSound (float value);
.method public static hidebysig pinvokeimpl ("openal32.dll" as "alSpeedOfSound" cdecl)void SpeedOfSound(float32 value) cil managed
static member SpeedOfSound : single -> unit

Docs.param: A negative or zero value will result in an error, and the command is ignored. Default: 343.3f (appropriate for velocity units of meters and air as the propagation medium). The current setting can be queried using AL.Get with parameter ALGetFloat.SpeedOfSound.
Docs.summary: AL.SpeedOfSound allows the application to change the reference (propagation) speed used in the Doppler calculation. The source and listener velocities should be expressed in the same units as the speed of sound.
